question: who ordered the forbidden city to be built
api_result: The Forbidden City in Beijing, China, was ordered to be built by the Yongle Emperor of the Ming Dynasty. The construction began in 1406 and was completed in 1420. The Yongle Emperor commissioned the massive palace complex as a symbol of his power and as the new seat of his dynasty, moving the capital from Nanjing to Beijing. The Forbidden City served as the imperial palace and the political heart of China for almost 500 years, until the end of the Qing Dynasty in 1912.
